intro: Weihea malosana, commonly known as the Tahitian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in moist, sunny environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
